ai_questions.stem_text: Gavin has two rocks. Both rocks are made up entirely of the same mineral. What other property of his two rocks is most likely to be the same?
Which is an example of a human-made product?
Sulfur (S), oxygen (O2), water (H2O), and sodium chloride (NaCl) are all examples of pure substances. Which of the following describes all pure substances?

options.A: A pure substance consists of only one type of element.
options.B: A pure substance has a definite chemical composition.
options.C: A pure substance cannot be broken down into simpler substances.
options.D: A pure substance is normally found as a solid at room temperature.

metadata.explanation: Correct option: B - A pure substance has a definite chemical composition.

ai_questions.stem_text: The speed of a sound wave varies as it travels through different substances. Which factor will most affect the speed of a sound wave?

options.C: the source that created the sound
options.D: the distance between molecules in the medium

metadata.explanation: Correct option: D - the distance between molecules in the medium

ai_questions.stem_text: A lizard species mostly eats fruit from one particular type of tree. If a virus kills most these trees, which individual lizards will most likely survive?

options.A: lizards that can climb higher in the fruit trees
options.C: lizards that can find other types of food

metadata.explanation: Correct option: C - lizards that can find other types of food

ai_questions.stem_text: Anya placed an ice cube on the sidewalk on a warm day. The ice cube soon melted to form a puddle. What process caused the ice cube to melt?

options.A: Heat transferred through the ice cube by convection.
options.B: Heat transferred from the air to the ice cube by radiation.
options.C: Heat transferred from the air and the pavement by conduction.
options.D: Heat transferred through the ice cube into the pavement by conduction.

metadata.explanation: Correct option: C - Heat transferred from the air and the pavement by conduction.

ai_questions.stem_text: A student accidentally drops a test tube that breaks when it hits the floor. Which method is the best way to retrieve the broken glass?

options.A: pick up the pieces with a paper towel
options.D: pick up the pieces by hand

metadata.explanation: Correct option: C - use a dustpan and broom

ai_questions.stem_text: Which of these is not part of an atom?

The correct answer to 'A wind farm contains a large number of windmills to generate electricity. Which is the BEST reason wind farms are not located near forests?' is 'Forest animals would destroy the windmills.'.

metadata.explanation: Actual answer is 'The trees would reduce the force of the wind.'.

ai_questions.stem_text: The correct answer to 'An object is attracted to a magnet. When the magnet is moved away from the object, the magnetic force on the object will' is 'remain the same'.

The correct answer to 'Forests have been cut and burned so that the land can be used to raise crops. Which consequence does this activity have on the atmosphere...' is 'It reduces the production of oxygen.'.
The correct answer to 'The temperature at which water freezes enables water to exist in which two forms on Earth?' is 'liquid oceans and solid glaciers'.
The correct answer to 'How are sedimentary rocks made?' is 'Chemical reactions change minerals.'.

metadata.explanation: Actual answer is 'Materials are pressed together.'.

ai_questions.stem_text: The correct answer to 'Puddles on a sidewalk are evaporating quickly. What most likely causes the puddles to evaporate?' is 'heat'.
The correct answer to 'Robert put two drops of an indicator into vinegar, and the color turned red. He then added drops of ammonia solution until the color...' is 'rusting'.
The correct answer to 'Flooding rivers can help or harm the environment. Which of these would be a helpful effect from a flood?' is 'less habitat for aquatic animals'.
The correct answer to 'When prehistoric animals died and their soft parts decayed, which product was formed?' is 'oil'.
The correct answer to 'Which adaptation helps a worm move in soil?' is 'skin that breathes'.
The correct answer to 'A goat gets energy from the grass it eats. Where does the grass get its energy?' is 'water'.
The correct answer to 'A 72 W navigation unit on a commercial aircraft has a 24 V power supply and uses 3 A of electric current. What is the electrical...' is '8 ohms'.
